snippet: An illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods was first brought to the attention of Masters officials in a text message, highlighting the unusual relationship between those who enforce the rules and television viewers.
abstract: Illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods during Masters was first brought to attention of officials via text message, highlighting unusual relationship between golf officials and spectators; television viewers have multiple ways of contacting tournament officials, making golf a rare sport in which real-time communication between armchair viewership and referees supervising competition routinely changes rulings and alters outcomes of tournaments.

byline.original: By BILL PENNINGTON and KAREN CROUSE

lead_paragraph: An illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods was first brought to the attention of Masters officials in a text message, highlighting the unusual relationship between those who enforce the rules and television viewers.

headline.seo: By Phone or by Text, Golf Entertains Second-Guessers
headline.main: Attention, Second-Guessers: Golf Takes Calls (and Texts)
headline.print_headline: Attention, Second-Guessers: Golf Takes Calls (and Texts)
